Streamline your design workflow by automating repetitive design tasks such as banners, social media posts, product catalogs, and more.

plugins.name: Dummy datazer
plugins.description:
The Dummy datazer plugin enhances your Figma design workflow by allowing you to replace text in selected text layers with randomly generated data. With this plugin, you can effortlessly populate your designs with realistic placeholders, including:


- Full Names : Choose from a diverse list of 100 full names.

- Company Names : Select from 50 company names.

- Addresses : Utilize 50 unique addresses for location-based designs.

- Phone Numbers : Insert 50 different phone numbers for contact information.

Simply select the text layers you wish to update, choose the type of data you want to insert, and let the plugin do the rest. The Dummy datazer ensures your designs are filled with dynamic and varied content, perfect for mockups and testing scenarios.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Populate Your Designs with Dynamic Data

plugins.name: The Settler â€” localiser for external (or missing) alias variables
plugins.description:
(Ğ ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ·Ñƒ ğŸ‘‡)

en:

This plugin localises all alias variables that refer to missing base variables (those located in external files or simply deleted)

ğŸ¦ Video demonstration: https://youtu.be/f9Ofv7lB-Lk


Why is this a problem?! Figma doesn't care about these links, it doesn't transfer them to the new file, but leaves the links to the companion variables (base/master variables) in the old file. And this isn't what you expect when you copy variables :)


In simple words, what the plugin does:

  1. It looks for alias variables that have a reference to base variables that didn't make it to this file (either left in another file or simply missing)
  2. Creates copies of such variables in this file
  3. Rebinds the alias variable, changing the reference from the external master variable (base variable) to the newly created local one


Works for variables of all types:

  1. color,
  2. text,
  3. boolean,
  4. numeric

It should work with multiple mods, but I haven't tested this part.

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

109166.name: SupaFastPages
109166.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

â€¢Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
â€¢Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
â€¢Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

â€¢Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays â€œSelect an Optionâ€ and is disabled. When the user selects either â€œSectionsâ€ or â€œFrames,â€ the text changes to â€œConvert,â€ and the button becomes enabled.
â€¢Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

â€¢Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When â€œSectionsâ€ or â€œFramesâ€ is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
â€¢Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

â€¢Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

plugins.name: Figma to BlocksIn System
plugins.description:
The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.


BlocksIn System - React Component Library


Here's how it simplifies your workflow:


  • Design: Create patterns using Figma components.
  • Generate: Select a frame and click 'Generate' to convert it into React markup.
  • Implement: Seamlessly integrate the code with BlocksIn System React components.
  • Reuse: Streamline your process by reusing design patterns.


Watch the video here.


Special thanks to my friend Eugenio who inspired this project. Check out his amazing work.


Get started with the BlocksIn System plugin and revolutionise your design-to-development process!
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into React BlocksIn System components effortlessly.

plugins.name: Fancy Figma to Bricks builder
plugins.description:
Forget doing things twice â€” design smarter by managing your variables, color palette and designs in Figma, then effortlessly transfer everything into Bricks builder with just a few clicks.


Plugin video: https://youtu.be/5_52ZX3yfGQ


Website: https://fancyframework.com/figma-plugin/


Purchase an early adopter license for 10 instances*: BUY NOW

Documentation: https://fancyframework.com/docs/

Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/fancybricks

YouTube: https://youtube.com/@fancybricks


* An instance refers to each individual installation of the software, whether on different devices or platforms. For example, if you activate the license on the desktop app and also use it on the web version, even with the same user account, it will count as two separate instances.


How it works?


Fancy Framework for Figma streamlines your workflow in three simple steps â€” from defining your design system in Figma to building real pages in Bricks. Hereâ€™s how:


Set up your design variables in Figma

Define your entire design system directly in Figma â€” colors, typography, spacing, and more. Group and name your variables for better clarity and consistency across your designs.


Export your variables and color palette to Bricks

With just a few clicks, convert your Figma variables into Bricks-compatible values. Keep your color system consistent across design and development â€” no need to manually recreate anything.


Copy from Figma, paste into Bricks

Select any Auto Layout section in Figma, copy it, and paste it directly into the Bricks editor. Supports autolayout, semantic tags, classes, grids and native Bricks elements â€” just like you designed it.


Main features

Fancy Figma to bricks builder plugin gives you everything you need to streamline your workflow: organize design variables, export color palettes, and paste fully structured sections directly into Bricks. No more duplicated effort â€” just clean, scalable, and efficient web design.


Advanced variable support

Use calc, rem, number and clamp() directly in your Figma variables for greater flexibility and control.


Auto-generate color variations

Generate transparent, darkened, and lightened versions of your colors instantly â€” no need to create them manually. Perfect for building accessible and consistent UI systems.


Export dynamic variables to Bricks

Thanks to support for clamp, calc, rem, and numeric operations, your Figma variables are ready for real-world usage inside Bricks â€” no tweaks needed.


Bricks-ready color palette export

Automatically export your color palette from Figma, linked directly to your variables â€” ready to import into Bricks and use seamlessly across your entire site.


Seamless copy-paste from Figma to Bricks

Copy any section built with Auto Layout in Figma and paste it directly into Bricks â€” layout structure, classes, and semantic tags all preserved.


Copy-Paste Features


Built for Auto Layout

By following best practices, your sections will copy perfectly into Bricks â€” layout, spacing, and hierarchy intact. Check out my free figma course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbc4J3wWyVcdnL9A_UA-WdE2tXRUW-I8O


Semantic HTML tag support

Your Figma sections can include semantic tags like [section], [container], [ul], [li], [h1â€“h6], [p], [span], and more. Perfect for SEO, accessibility, and clean markup.


Support for display grid

Display grid support uses (grid-x) (grid-x-x) to apply display: grid in Bricks automatically when pasting.


Class-friendly workflow

Use meaningful class names in Figma and watch them transfer seamlessly into Bricks. Combine with utility classes for maximum flexibility and control.


Bricks-native element compatibility

Paste sections that automatically map to Bricks' native elements like:

  1. Buttons
  2. Links
  3. SVG
  4. Forms
  5. Tabs
  6. Accordions
  7. Nav menu
  8. Logo
  9. Counters
  10. More will be added
plugins.tagline: The ultimate web design workflow for Bricks Builder

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click â€œOpen Voice Toolâ€ â†’ Start speaking in the browser â†’ Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


âœ… Use Case 1:

â€œTired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?â€

Speak directly into the pluginâ€™s voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text boxâ€”no tab switching, no distractions.


âœ… Use Case 2:

â€œWant to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?â€

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your designâ€”perfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

âœ… Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

ğŸ• Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

ğŸŒ Browser Compatibility:

âœ… Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

âš ï¸ Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

âŒ Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

ğŸ§  Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

ğŸ™ Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

ğŸ–¥ï¸ Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

âœ… Accessibility Enhancements

â¤ï¸ Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins canâ€™t access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally â€” nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades â€” instantly and intelligently. Whether youâ€™re starting a new design system or refining an existing one, this plugin makes it easy to generate consistent, customizable color variables in Figma.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork â€” Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.

  1. Enter your base colors and give them names
  2. Press â€œGenerate Variablesâ€
  3. Orange Tokens generates variables with tints, shades, and smart naming
  4. Use the generated palette directly as design tokens, or tweak and reuse them across your system.


âœ¨ Features

  3. Design tokenâ€“friendly naming system
  4. Organized Figma variables by base name

Orange Tokens applies a structured algorithm to your base hex values, producing harmonious tints and shades. Each palette is mapped to a name you provide (like green, orange, blue) and creates a set of Figma variables grouped logically â€” perfect for scaling your system with consistency.


Everything happens in a few clicks, without breaking your existing styles or variables.

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Smart Selection
plugins.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics â€” save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

plugins.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
plugins.description:
The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.


Key Features:

  1. 200% Text Resize: Duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All Component Checking: Works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line Height Adjustments: Allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.
plugins.tagline: Check the behavior of your design system components according to the 200% text resize (WCAG 2.2)

Key Features:

  2. All Component Checking: Works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line Height Adjustments: Allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text youâ€™d like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the pluginâ€™s interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

  2. Automatic Previews: Visuals attach directly to the work item.
  3. Direct Linking: Clickable links between Azure work items and components.
  4. Custom Field Mapping: Match your Azure setup with flexible field configs.
  5. Team Area Support: Organize work in your projectâ€™s structure.
  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save timeâ€”no more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)
  3. Enter your Azure DevOps URL
  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create
